programme.title: Britain's War of Thrones: The Hundred Years War, with Dan Jones
programme.desc: Dan Jones, writer, historian and consultant on Knightfall, continues his exploration of the Hundred Years War..

programme.title: Pirate Traders
programme.desc: Tony and the team have their sights set on a Hummer H1, a highly specialised military vehicle. However, getting their hands on one proves far from easy.

programme.title: Swamp People
programme.desc: Willie runs out of bullets and is forced to take on a huge gator with a pocket knife. Troy places a risky wager, and needs his sons to excel themselves if he is to win.

programme.title: Knightfall
programme.sub-title: Hard Blows Will Banish the Sin
programme.desc: Tensions are high during Isabella's wedding preparations as, fearing an attack, King Philip asks Landry and the Knights Templar for their help in protecting the palace. Drama, starring Tom Cullen.

programme.title: Knightfall
programme.desc: Landry is kidnapped and tortured by a mysterious group, a knight is expelled from the Templars, De Nogaret builds an army, while Princess Isabella discovers who betrayed her. Part-fictionalised drama, starring Tom Cullen, Jim Carter and Padraic Delaney.

programme.title: Knightfall
programme.desc: Landry and Gawain meet a mysterious woman who claims she can lead them to the Grail, Joan hears of an attack on Navarre, while De Nogaret devises a way to improve his standing with King Philip. Part-fictionalised drama, starring Tom Cullen, Jim Carter and Padraic Delaney.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz discover a train station full of vintage cars, and make some surprising finds in an old barn.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Experts examine the belief that gifted children with strange abilities and great knowledge may have been born from ancient aliens.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Across the world, there are stories of treasures that have been lost for centuries. This programme considers that these ancient relics have been hidden by extraterrestrials.

programme.title: World's Deadliest Weather: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: A record-breaking cyclone wrecks South Pacific islands, a cruise ship becomes stranded in a storm, and two friends get caught in a deadly avalanche.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz visit a farm in need of vital funds, before exploring a boarded-up cheese factory and an underground railroad site.

programme.title: Irish Pickers
programme.desc: Ian and Butzy drop in on Killeneure Castle, before rock 'n' rolling to Limerick City for pop memorabilia from U2 and Thin Lizzy, along with the bar that film star Oliver Reed drank at.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen Haff and Ton Jones discover a railroad maintenance car and a Japanese pistol manufactured before the First World War when they attend a silent auction in Alaska.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen Haff and Ton Jones have to fight off competition from notorious auction hunter Mad Dog in Glendale, California, and manage to secure a vintage drum kit.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen Haff and Ton Jones discover a pair of duelling pistols and a vintage airboat, and try to sell them at an auction in New Orleans.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: The guys find an antique barber's chair, two lawnmowers and a voodoo chest, and try selling the items on at an auction in Louisiana.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Ton and Allen start a bidding war at an auction in Washington, DC, where they set out to sell a Civil War-era revolver and some South African gold coins.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: The guys find a vintage military motorcycle and replica cannon in Arlington, Virginia.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen Haff and Ton Jones discover a rare punt gun after winning two units at an auction in Pasadena.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen Haff and Ton Jones discover a 1969 Chevelle Malibu muscle car in a unit auction in Covina, California.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Dave surprises his rivals by revealing a lighter side to his nature, and Jarrod and Brandi return to the site of a past triumph.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Revisiting the most memorable finds from Storage Wars history, including one alarming discovery that has never been seen before.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers return to Montebello, California, where Rene and Casey unsuccessfully try to throw off the competition. Ivy secures his skating equipment.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: A compilation of some of the biggest mistakes made by bidders in the series' history - as well as previously unseen footage of an explosive argument.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Rene and Casey attempt to shut out Jarrod and Brandi, Darrell uncovers an interesting locker, while Ivy meets a furry friend. Reality series following people who make a living from bidding for the contents of abandoned storage units.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: A compilation of clips examining the series' most and least successful bidding tactics, from secret plots to Barry's bizarre schemes.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Ivy tries to keep his winning streak going, while Darrell and Rene play mind games with each other. Jarrod and Brandi visit a crime scene and travel back in time.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Brandi is intent on closing the Long Beach store, but Jarrod is determined to save it by scoring more lockers. Ivy tries to intimidate other buyers, while Darrell gets the shock treatment.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.sub-title: Storage Wars: Best of the Appraisals
programme.desc: The best moments from the series where experts and collectors pass judgement on how much the bidders' purchases are worth.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.sub-title: The Return of the King of Montebello
programme.desc: Ivy hires someone to look after his shop, while Jarrod and Brandi split up for auctions in Montebello.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter: Most Wanted
programme.desc: Saving Jamie.

programme.title: Billion Dollar Wreck
programme.sub-title: Billion Dollar Wreck: The Mysterious Treasure of the Republic
programme.desc: Martin Bayerle investigates the 1909 shipwreck of RMS Republic, 50 miles off the coast of Nantucket, and attempts to prove the existence of her $1billion bounty.

programme.title: Britain's War of Thrones: The Hundred Years War, with Dan Jones
programme.desc: The historian and writer documents the turbulent conflicts between the French royal houses of Valois and Burgundy, and their Plantagenet rivals in England, which exploded with such ferociousness in the colossal struggle of The Hundred Years War, forging the history of medieval and early modern Europe.

programme.title: World's Deadliest Weather: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: A record-breaking cyclone wrecks South Pacific islands, a cruise ship becomes stranded in a storm, and two friends get caught in a deadly avalanche.

programme.title: Dave Gorman: Terms and Conditions Apply
programme.desc: Sally Phillips, Desiree Burch and Jessica Knappett join Dave to try to unscramble the seemingly scrambled.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.sub-title: Have I Got a Bit More Old News for You
programme.desc: Actor David Tennant takes over the reins for extended edition of the satirical quiz from November 2018, with comedian Reginald D Hunter and playwright Lucy Prebble joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Bill Bailey, Colin Lane and Desiree Burch join regular panellist Alan Davies to answer host Sandi Toksvig's questions on the theme 'Overseas', in an extended edition of the unorthodox quiz. During the course of the show, the panellists find out about Allotment Annies as well as who keeps their brothers in a cage. The fiendishly difficult questions lead to points being awarded for the answers the questionmaster considers most interesting, though not necessarily correct.

programme.title: Red Dwarf
programme.desc: An identical ship materialises alongside Starbug - and the crew members are alarmed to receive an SOS call from themselves, 15 years in the future. Sci-fi comedy, starring Chris Barrie, Craig Charles, Robert Llewellyn and Danny John-Jules.

programme.title: Jon Richardson: Ultimate Worrier
programme.desc: In the final episode, Jon Richardson is joined by Jack Dee and Ivo Graham as they address some of Jon's worries and fears about family life.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Late Nite Eats
programme.desc: Chef Jordan Andino is on the hunt to find restaurants that reign supreme in the late-night food scene, meeting other chefs to taste their most popular dishes.

programme.title: Late Nite Eats
programme.desc: Chef Jordan Andino is on the hunt to find restaurants that reign supreme in the late-night food scene, meeting other chefs to taste their most popular dishes.

programme.title: Steve Austin's Broken Skull Challenge
programme.sub-title: Second Place Is a Piece of S***!
programme.desc: The former wrestler challenges eight contestants to triumph over a series of gruelling physical endurance tests.

programme.title: Expedition with Steve Backshall
programme.desc: In the Jebel Akhdar mountain range of Oman, Steve leads an expedition into an unexplored desert canyon. With temperatures soaring, dehydration and heat stroke are a constant threat.

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: An extraordinary Red Bull Soapbox course at the Yomiuriland Amusement Park in Tokyo. The course includes a unique see-saw feature and a wicked berm.

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: The teams take on one of the steepest courses in Red Bull Soapbox Race history in Lithuania. Will the soapboxes cope with the water jump and savage bone-rattler?.

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: Gavin starts his job in Cardiff and, while Stacey is thrilled to be back in Wales, Smithy has to come to terms with living in Essex without his best friend. Nessa has taken up residence in Dave's caravan in Sully and is getting ready for Neil's christening. The event means a big reunion for the gang, at which Smithy receives surprising news from Nessa, and Stacey has a special request for her husband.

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: Dave is unhappy about Nessa's plans to let Smithy see the baby, while Stacey ensures Gavin sticks to his promise as she tries to find a new job. Meanwhile, Dawn and Pete join Pam and Mick for a beer and curry night. Comedy, starring Joanna Page and Mathew Horne.

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: Bryn is in his element as he awaits the arrival of the Essex boys, who are having a big night out in Cardiff and staying for a sleepover, but Smithy is concerned about seeing Nessa again after their last meeting. Meanwhile, Stacey tells Gavin about a worrying discovery, and Pam and Mick discuss their plans for a new conservatory.

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: Everyone gathers in Billericay as Pete and Dawn prepare to renew their wedding vows. Gavin feels uncomfortable about Gwen and Bryn knowing the details of his sex life, and Dave hears about the shocking events of the curry night. Meanwhile, Smithy goes beyond the call of friendship when he makes a staggering suggestion.

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: Bank Holiday Monday sees the Essex contingent arrive for a sunny day at the beach in Barry. Gavin has a heart-to-heart with his dad, which gives him much to think about, while a dark cloud looms on the horizon when Dave arrives to find Nessa and Smithy enjoying all the fun of the fair. Mathew Horne, Joanna Page, James Corden and Ruth Jones star.

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: Preparations for Nessa and Dave's wedding are in full swing, Stacey has life-changing news for Gavin, and Bryn and Jason put their big secret to bed once and for all. Finally, the wedding arrives and, as Nessa prepares to make her way to the church, Smithy takes the opportunity to have one last chat. Mathew Horne, Joanna Page, James Corden, Ruth Jones and Rob Brydon star.

programme.title: Red Dwarf
programme.desc: Lister accidentally triggers off the ship's self-destruct sequence, and there is only one way to diffuse the bomb, by lending his body to a female officer. Cult sci-fi comedy, starring Chris Barrie, Craig Charles and Danny John-Jules.

programme.title: Red Dwarf
programme.desc: Kryten discovers a developing fluid has mutated, causing photographs to come to life and giving Lister a chance to change the past and avoid ever becoming lost in deep space. Sci-fi comedy, starring Chris Barrie, Craig Charles, Robert Llewellyn and Danny John-Jules.

programme.title: Red Dwarf
programme.desc: Kryten discovers his expiry date is less than 24 hours away, prompting Lister and Rimmer to organise a party he will never forget, but when the mechanoid decides to avoid being shut down he does not realise his actions could cost the rest of the crew their lives. Sci-fi comedy, starring Craig Charles and Chris Barrie.

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: More thrills, spills, customer carts and crashes in this extreme downhill battle at the Eduardo VII Park in Lisbon.

programme.title: Expedition with Steve Backshall
programme.desc: In the Jebel Akhdar mountain range of Oman, Steve leads an expedition into an unexplored desert canyon. With temperatures soaring, dehydration and heat stroke are a constant threat.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Bill Bailey, Colin Lane and Desiree Burch join regular panellist Alan Davies to answer host Sandi Toksvig's questions on the theme 'Overseas', in an extended edition of the unorthodox quiz. During the course of the show, the panellists find out about Allotment Annies as well as who keeps their brothers in a cage. The fiendishly difficult questions lead to points being awarded for the answers the questionmaster considers most interesting, though not necessarily correct.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.sub-title: Have I Got a Bit More Old News for You
programme.desc: Actor David Tennant takes over the reins for extended edition of the satirical quiz from November 2018, with comedian Reginald D Hunter and playwright Lucy Prebble joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Stephen Fry hosts an extended version of the quiz with a difference, with guests Matt Lucas, Lucy Porter and Ross Noble joining regular panellist Alan Davies, focusing on medical matters.

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.sub-title: Nish Kumar, Luisa Omielan, David O'Doherty
programme.desc: Last week saw the return of the comedy show in which three comedians take the stage of the Hammersmith Apollo in west London. The premise is simple. One comic acts as host, warming up the audience before introducing short sets by two other stand-ups. Future editions promise the likes of Ed Byrne, Rob Beckett, Joel Dommett, Henning Wehn, Lucy Porter, but tonight Nish Kumar plays host, before handing over to David O'Doherty and Luisa Omielan.

programme.title: Train Truckers
programme.desc: Expert hauliers Eric Harrison and Chris Case move an iconic Deltic diesel, better known as The Royal Highland Fusilier, halfway across the country to the Telford Steam Fair.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: A new building changing the iconic Manhattan skyline, which engineers believe will be the most slender skyscraper ever built, as they push the boundaries in skyscraper construction.

programme.title: Coast
programme.desc: The team travels from Dover to the Isle of Wight. Geographer Nicholas Crane hangs off the cliffs near Beachy Head, East Sussex, to discover how the chalk coastline was formed and historian Neil Oliver investigates why the Victorian Channel Tunnel was started more than 120 years ago but never finished. Meanwhile, anthropologist Alice Roberts visits the Isle of Wight, where she meets the men who helped launch Britain's first satellite.

programme.title: Operation Gold Rush with Dan Snow
programme.desc: Dan Snow, Felicity Aston and Dr Kevin Fong finally arrive at the end of their gruelling journey in Dawson City. They set up a traditional mining camp in the heart of the gold fields, before facing their next challenge. They have just five days to find gold in an area that has already been heavily mined, and can only use the back-breaking methods of the 19th-century early pioneers.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Coast
programme.desc: The team travels along the 100-mile stretch of coast between Holyhead and Liverpool. Miranda Krestovnikoff searches for one of the longest-living creatures on the planet in the Menai Straits, while Alice Roberts discovers how a young survivor of a shipwreck helped to found modern orthopaedic surgery. Nick Crane investigates beach pebbles, and Neil Oliver looks around a mysterious cave on the Great Orme.

programme.title: Coast
programme.desc: The team travels down the west of Scotland, through the mountainous terrain of Arran toward the English border at Gretna. En route they pass Prestwick Airport, the impressive mudflats of Solway Firth, and the Ardeer dunes, where 19th-century inventor Alfred Nobel built what was then the world's largest explosives factory. Neil Oliver presents.

programme.title: World War Weird
programme.desc: Unexplained events during wartime, including German submarines that discovered previously unknown sea creatures and a Japanese bomb that floated on the jet stream.

programme.title: World War Weird
programme.desc: Featuring a look at sightings of UFOs during the Second World War, a US plan to use bats against Japan's cities, and a German attempt to persuade British POWs to change sides.

programme.title: World War Weird
programme.desc: The search for looted gold hidden by the Nazis in North Africa. Plus, how the Russian army used dogs as a secret weapon and a mysterious message just before the Pearl Harbor attack.

programme.title: World War Weird
programme.desc: How Russian scientists tried to create a human-ape hybrid in the 1920s. Plus, a mysterious airship crash and a disease outbreak that may have been caused by bio-weapon experiments.

programme.title: World War Weird
programme.desc: How the UFO famously sighted at Roswell may have been an experimental aircraft developed by the Nazis during the Second World War. Plus, theories about Glenn Miller's disappearance.

programme.title: Warbird Workshop
programme.desc: Documentary following the engineers and aviators who battle to keep the UK's most historic warplanes in the air. In the first edition, the team rebuild a Spitfire MJ772.

programme.title: Warbird Workshop
programme.desc: A US Army Air Force C47 that dropped paratroopers on D-Day is at the centre of one of the UK's most ambitious warbird rebuilds.

programme.title: Warbird Workshop
programme.desc: A team of engineers fight to return a veteran Westland Wessex helicopter to the skies - 30 years after its last flight.

programme.title: Warbird Workshop
programme.desc: Aircraft restoration expert Mark Masters and his son James rebuild a 1943 US Army Aeronca Defender liaison plane for its German owner.

programme.title: Warbird Workshop
programme.desc: A group of amateur pilots find their light plane has a glorious war record - and launch an ambitious project to rebuild the Piper Cub and restore its military markings.

programme.title: Warbird Workshop
programme.desc: Documentary following the engineers and aviators who battle to keep the UK's most historic warplanes in the air. In the first edition, the team rebuild a Spitfire MJ772.

programme.title: Secrets of Britain
programme.sub-title: Secrets of Her Majesty's Secret Service
programme.desc: The documentary series exploring the less well known side of Britain continues, with this edition exploring MI6, asking whether the shadowy world of espionage and counter-intelligence operations bear any resemblance to the James Bond novels.

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.desc: The British airmen are captured while paddling down the estuary, so Rene and the Resistance launch a cunning plan to rescue them - using a couple of coffins.

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.desc: Herr Flick and Von Smallhausen prepare to meet their maker as they face a firing squad, while Madame Fanny discovers Edith in bed with the Fuehrer.

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.desc: Von Klinkerhoffen orders Rene and Edith to dress up as Hitler and Goering pretending to leave town so he can catch any Resistance group that tries to attack them. Meanwhile, Michelle plans to swap an eel containing the Fallen Madonna for a dog fish containing 10 million French francs.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek, with help from the Mathewson clan, drag a mini pickup out of the barn where it's been for 20 years, and a 350cc Douglas Mark V motorbike from 1950 goes under the hammer.

programme.title: History Hunters
programme.desc: A fascinating find from Normandy is brought into the shop. And Steve and Marie head to Oxford University to delve into the story behind a war hero's beautiful childhood scrapbook.

programme.title: Kavanagh QC
programme.desc: The barrister defends a British ambassador's daughter accused of murdering an Austrian journalist, and learns a harsh lesson in the realities of political and diplomatic power. Foxcott is singed by an old flame, while Matt risks his father's anger by moving into a squat. Legal drama, starring John Thaw, Lena Headey, Michael Feast and Oliver Ford Davies.

programme.title: Trial & Retribution
programme.desc: Part one of two. A massive police search leads to the body of a missing five-year-old, the victim of sexual assault and strangulation. All the evidence points to a local drunkard being the guilty party _ but as the case goes to trial it becomes clear that the outcome is by no means assured. Gripping crime drama by Lynda La Plante, starring David Hayman, Kate Buffery, Helen McCrory and Rhys Ifans.

programme.title: Garden Hopping
programme.desc: Daphne Ledward explores the historic city of Warwick as part of her National Gardens Scheme tour, discovering medieval buildings and the gardens of Lord Leycester Hospital.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Ramani realises Terry has been stabbed and rushes home in a bid to save him. Lance and Laura trace a suspect to a local pool hall, where they are taken aback to see Adam apparently buying drugs, while Samantha is impressed by Phil's uncharacteristic chivalry while working on a case, and asks if he'd like to get together with her socially. Unfortunately, their date is dramatically ruined by the reappearance of a figure from the past.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Okaro tries his best to keep it together at the funeral of his wife, son and daughter.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Drug dealer Adi Mateen is forced to reveal his true identity in a desperate bid to save Lance from gun-brandishing local youth Jordan Tomlin, and Samantha confronts Phil about Kate Maltby's pregnancy. Gina convinces herself that Adam is still hiding something, while Sheelagh works on a harassment case with Gabriel - only to discover the victim is his girlfriend.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Adam authorises DC Zain Nadir to meet Joshua Armstrong, a dealer at the top of the drugs chain - but the intervention of an armed motorcycle passenger threatens to cut short the entire investigation. Yvonne searches a storage unit hired by Honey's new husband Scott and finds a bloody glove, fuelling her suspicions that he killed his previous wife. Away from the line of duty, Phil angrily berates brother Steve for telling Kate Maltby about his daughter Madison.

programme.title: Catherine Cookson's The Wingless Bird
programme.desc: Feature-length melodrama set in 1913, about the romantic relationship between Agnes Conway, whose parents own a sweetshop, and Charles Farrier, son of an altogether grander family. Agnes faces an added dilemma when she finds her heart divided between Charles and his soldier brother Reginald. Starring Claire Skinner and Edward Atterton.

programme.title: David Copperfield
programme.desc: The rural idyll of eight-year-old David Copperfield is brought to an abrupt end when his widowed mother Clara remarries. Young David takes an instant dislike to Mr Murdstone, his new step-father, and the newcomer proves the feeling is more than mutual when he send the lad away to a boarding school run by a ruthless headmaster. Adaptation of the Dickens classic with an all-star cast, including Pauline Quirke, Maggie Smith and Ian McKellen, with a young Daniel Radcliffe starring in the title role.

programme.title: David Copperfield
programme.desc: David is sent to a workhouse by his evil stepfather following his mother's death. But he finds an unlikely ally in the eternally optimistic gambler Mr Micawber. Ciaran McMenamin, Bob Hoskins, Trevor Eve and Maggie Smith star in the second part of the Dickens tale.

programme.title: David Copperfield
programme.desc: Now an ambitious young man making a name for himself in London, David returns to Suffolk with his schoolfriend Steerpike in tow to catch up with Peggoty, his late mother's maid. Adaptation of the Dickens classic, starring Pauline Quirke and Ciaran McMenamin.

programme.title: David Copperfield
programme.desc: Micawber threatens to expose Uriah Heep for the devious character that he is, and David returns to Canterbury once again. Adaptation of the Dickens classic with an all-star cast, including Pauline Quirke, Maggie Smith, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Bob Hoskins.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: A rare disease spreads around Poplar Street, and Patsy and Dr Turner try to trace the outbreak to its source. Suspicion over the identity of the first carrier threatens to divide a previously close-knit family. Sister Winifred is forced to confront her prejudices while treating a patient, and Barbara worries about how Trixie will react when she agrees to go to dinner with Tom.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Sister Julienne is seconded to a maternity ward, and is impressed by how modern technology is being used to help the mothers - but is left with a moral dilemma after assisting on a traumatic birth. A young man from Poplar is delighted to be accepted into university, but his mother is less than happy. His dreams are jeopardised when his girlfriend gets pregnant, a development that puts pressure on the whole family.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: A campaigner against domestic violence is murdered and the prime suspect is an apparently reformed man whose violent behaviour once drove his ex-wife to almost kill him in self defence. Although the team is able to build a solid case against him, Ross jeopardises the investigation in a moment of madness. Glasgow-set detective drama, starring John Michie and Blythe Duff.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: A Polish man is killed on the building site where he worked and soon afterwards a female hotel receptionist is murdered in strikingly similar circumstances. Reid and the team learn she was an immigrant from the same country, and look into whether the killings were ethnically motivated or if there is another link between the pair. Meanwhile, Ross puts his career on the line by spending the night with a woman involved in the case. Blythe Duff and John Michie star.

programme.title: Rebus
programme.desc: In the tense build-up to a world trade summit in Edinburgh, Rebus looks forward to a well-earned day off - until Siobhan rings to say a body has been found in the grounds of the hotel hosting the conference. When a government minister is later killed in a fall from the castle ramparts, the abrasive copper comes up against Commander Steelforth of the SO12 unit providing security for the summit and, not for the first time, finds himself at odds with the Establishment. Julie Graham guest stars, with Ken Stott and Claire Price.

programme.title: Inception (2010)
programme.desc: A talented thief uses hi-tech devices to enter other people's dreams so he can steal their secrets. An industrialist hires him to perform a far more challenging job - to implant an idea into a corporate heir's mind, so he will think it is his own. However, the mission is compromised by the thief's own troubled psyche. Christopher Nolan's sci-fi thriller, starring Leonardo DiCaprio, Ellen Page, Joseph Gordon-Levitt and Tom Hardy.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Babushka
programme.desc: Game show hosted by Rylan Clark-Neal in which contestants answer questions to get the chance to open a set of 10 giant Russian nesting dolls, with some empty and others containing prizes up to 10,000

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technologies and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Robozuna
programme.desc: Children's sci-fi fantasy series about 14-year-old orphan Ariston and his robot Mangle, fighting an evil empire together.

programme.title: Dare Master
programme.desc: Danny's dare is to drive a tank blindfolded. Can he get across the course and knock down the cardboard box wall?.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Fizz has dressed Weasel up as a supervillain in order to pretend to save the city. Magoo mistakes his disguised neighbour for an actress in danger..

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Weasel accidentally launches Fizz next to Magoo. The latter, believing he is driving through a wildlife reserve, mistakes Fizz for a lost child..

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Magoo thinks he's underwater scooting and has discovered Atlantis. In fact, he's in New York, riding Fizz's latest invention..

programme.title: Scrambled!
programme.desc: Two hours of children's fun and entertainment.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr. Bean enters Scrapper into a beauty contest so that he can win First Prize: a trip with Irma to Paris..

programme.title: Ben 10
programme.desc: Ben, Gwen, and Grandpa Max arrive at a Native American national park to witness the Ayasha Plinths.

programme.title: The Epic Tales of Captain Underpants
programme.sub-title: Captain Underpants and the Frenzied Farts of Flabby Flabulous
programme.desc: An accident with Mr Meaner and Melvin's new machine turns the angry teacher into a super-villain..

programme.title: John and Lisa's Weekend Kitchen
programme.desc: Cookery show with John Torode and Lisa Faulkner, featuring recipes, shortcuts, inspiration and tips. The menu on this episode includes one pan spicy roast lamb and pear tarte tatin. Plus, The Great British Bake Off's John Whaite showcases his lemon drizzle cake and food writer Ching He Huang prepares teriyaki salmon.

programme.title: Ainsley's Mediterranean Cookbook
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott hops across to the Italian island of Sardinia, where his first stop is the beachside Ristorante La Spigola for a taste of chef Roberto's modern take on Italian dining. He also gets immersed in a classic Sardinian culinary experience, cooking suckling pig over an open fire, has a masterclass in making the local pasta Jiusoni and learns about another island speciality, casizolu cheese.

programme.title: St Davids - Britain's Smallest City
programme.desc: Documentary about the people who live and work in one of west Wales' most famous and historic communities - the city of St Davids in Pembrokeshire, which has fewer than 2,000 residents. An aeroplane pilot is forced to make an emergency landing on Whitesands beach, while the National Trust wardens try to round up some wild ponies. The men and women go head to head at the Penknife Club fishing competition.

programme.title: Best Walks with a View with Julia Bradbury
programme.sub-title: Britain's Best Walks with Julia Bradbury
programme.desc: The presenter heads to Loch Lomond, a freshwater Scottish loch famously celebrated in song that crosses the Highland Boundary Fault and is the largest inland stretch of water in Great Britain by surface area. Taking in the popular West Highland way, it's just a quick boat ride to the idyllic island of Inchailloch, a jewel in the loch's crown, where stunning views over the immense mass of water can be enjoyed.

programme.title: The Voice UK
programme.sub-title: The Voice UK: Most Memorable Moments
programme.desc: Will.i.am introduces some of the highlights of the past four series, recalling some of the performances in the Blind Auditions that got the coaches' chairs in a spin, as well as memorable moments from the Battle and Knockout rounds.

programme.title: Ant & Dec's Saturday Night Takeaway
programme.desc: The popular duo's entertainment show, featuring undercover pranks, surprises galore, star guests and a chance for a member of the audience to win the items advertised in one of last week's commercial breaks.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A land dispute escalates during a cowboy fair run by the Wild West Society in the village of Ford Florey. Farmers Jack Fincher and Silas Burbage both claim to own a patch of wasteland known as the Swamp, but Dan Malko wants to buy it and create a travellers' site. Barnaby and Jones are called in when the feud leads to murder during the Wild West-style shoot-outs at the annual event. Guest starring Kenneth Cranham, with John Nettles and Jason Hughes.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: A team of five family members answer questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then try to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money. Hosted by Warwick Davis.

programme.title: Tipping Point: Lucky Stars
programme.desc: Ben Shephard invites Strictly judge Bruno Tonioli, TV doctor Zoe Williams and former Corrie actress Catherine Tyldesley to take part in a special edition of the quiz show, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the better their chances of collecting the 20,000 prize for their selected charity.

programme.title: The Family Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents the special edition of the game show in which four relatives team up - this week the Walmsleys from Leyland - and pit their wits against one of the finest quiz brains in the country, in the hope of taking away thousands of pounds.

programme.title: The Good Karma Hospital
programme.desc: As AJ returns to the hospital keen to impress, Aisha and Lydia come to blows managing Jyoti's case and Greg discovers a shocking secret that Tommy has been hiding. Ruby helps Ted track down a possible lead, while her relationship with Gabriel hits obstacles. Medical drama, starring Amanda Redman, Amrita Acharia, Neil Morrissey, Kenneth Cranham and Priyanka Bose.

programme.title: Belgravia
programme.desc: John appeals to members of the Trenchards' staff in his bid to uncover the truth about Charles, while Turton and Ellis are quick to betray their employers and prove surprisingly adept at deceit and spying. Susan makes a seemingly miraculous discovery, and begrudgingly agrees to accompany Anne and James to their country estate in the hope of extracting further information about Oliver. Stephen makes a last-ditch attempt to secure the funds he needs to pay off his debt - a deal that puts his life in danger.

programme.title: The Olivier Awards
programme.desc: Jason Manford presents the best moments from the past few moments of the theatrical awards, with a line-up of star-studded cast of award-winners and presenters taking to the stage to celebrate the best in live theatre. Including performances by the casts of The Lion King, Mamma Mia!, The Book of Mormon, Hamilton, Dreamgirls, Come from Away and Joseph and the Amazing Technicolor Dreamcoat.

programme.title: Secrets of the Driving Test
programme.desc: An insight into the world of the driving test, filmed over a two-year period and offering unprecedented access to the Driver and Vehicle Standards Agency (DVSA), with cameras fitted inside and outside of the test car. In the first episode, examiner Wayne has the task of taking 27-year-old Shaunna from Hull through the driving test, which will be her 12th attempt at passing. In Cardiff, Drew is desperate to pass, if only to stop the arguments with his partner Karl, who's been teaching him to drive. Narrated by Alan Carr.

programme.title: The Trouble with Maggie Cole
programme.desc: Maggie is in need of some time alone so she heads to the pub to see if she can get a room for the night, where she learns the real story of landlord Brian. When she finds out there are no rooms free for her to stay, Maggie decides to go and stay with daughter-in-law Becka, and the pair have a rare moment of bonding. Meanwhile, Peter is working late at the school when his secretary Karen reveals her feelings towards him in a very unexpected way. Later, Alex desperately tries to find the 'lottery' winnings' to pay off the lenders.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: In Sheepyards, the Bushmen are desperate for a breakthrough after a run of bad luck. In White Cliffs, the Young Guns are under financial strain and fall out over their new mine.

programme.title: Explosions Gone Wrong
programme.desc: Experts examine the science behind big blasts and suggest how they can be prevented. Featuring footage of exploding buildings, roads, trains and other vehicles.

programme.title: Quest for Captain Kidd
programme.desc: Barry Clifford travels to Madagascar, where he discovers relics and traces of the ship that once belonged to one of the world's most infamous pirates.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.desc: The teams sets about building a bike for Mike Buehrle of the Chicago White Sox baseball team, and Paul Jr pushes himself hard to get his new company up and running.

programme.title: Airplane Repo
programme.desc: Adrenaline junkie Mike Kennedy sets out into the remote Alaskan wilderness, braving wolf country and bitter temperatures, in a hunt for a Piper Super Cub.

programme.title: Dirty Jobs
programme.desc: Mike Rowe takes on a succession of unpleasant tasks, this time learning how to make maple syrup.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: How skateboards are manufactured and braided pastry produced, and how techniques have changed with the passage of time.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: The manufacturing process behind plasma gems are manufactured and a look at how special effects snow is made.

programme.title: Expedition Mungo
programme.sub-title: South American Squatch of Argentina: Expedition Mungo
programme.desc: A bigfoot-like beast with superhuman strength is reported to live in the foothills of the Andes. Mungo goes on the trail of the Ucumar, believed to be a bear - or even a yeti.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Skilled 'pickers' Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz help find an important part for a million-dollar car. Later, the guys pick over a massive bike shop closed since the 1980s.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Modern day treasure hunter Drew Pritchard travels the length and breadth of the UK in search of weird and wonderful objects.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer and Ant Anstead claim ownership of a seriously distressed 1965 Dodge A-100 Sportsman, and hopes a custom-built surf inspired makeover will be enough to attract a buyer.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Smart city car the Fiat Panda is also a surprisingly good off-road hack. Mike Brewer tracks down a 4x4 model with potential, passing the vehicle on to mechanic Edd China, as the pair try to turn a profit improving its credentials before selling it on.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Modern day treasure hunter Drew Pritchard travels the length and breadth of the UK in search of weird and wonderful objects. The bigger the hoard, the happier he is.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard mixes with aristocracy at a Cornwall estate where he is blown away by a collection of classic cars. In Newark, Nottinghamshire, he finds a huge hoard of enamel signs for the oil industry.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard visits a fledgling antiques business run by an enterprising young couple in London. Plus, he faces punishing negotiations at a living history museum in Surrey.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard delves into the history of print on London's Fleet Street. Plus, in Devon, he indulges his passion for architectural salvage.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard finds a mysterious piece of black pottery in Lancashire, locates an exotic piece in a zoo in East Anglia and fiercely haggles with an old foe in a salvage yard.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: Classic Cars
programme.desc: Salvage aficionado Drew Pritchard and Turbo Pickers' Paul Cowland head to the Midlands to look at a Swedish classic - the Volvo Amazon. When Paul falls for an early Toyota MR2, he seeks a way to convince Drew it will turn a profit.

programme.title: Fantomworks
programme.desc: Part one of two. Arthur brings in his 1967 Cyclone, hoping the team can make it better than new. Antonio and Andres challenge Dan to build the fastest Mustang CS in Mexico.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Skilled 'pickers' Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz help find an important part for a million-dollar car. Later, the guys pick over a massive bike shop closed since the 1980s.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Steve Fletcher brings a German-made toy steam roller from the 1930s back to life, and Matthew Nickels pieces together a damaged glass picture window.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Top salvage expert Drew Pritchard breaks new ground with his first-ever buying trip to Northern Ireland, where he gets 'trollied' and falls for a vintage Japanese item.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Modern day treasure hunter Drew Pritchard travels the length and breadth of the UK in search of weird and wonderful objects.

programme.title: Scrap Kings
programme.desc: In Cheshire, a well-known hotel is pulled to the ground. Meanwhile, in Devon a father and son demolish a caravan and in Liverpool an iconic landmark is made from scrap.

programme.title: Cooper's Treasure
programme.desc: Treasure hunter Darrell Miklos attempts to decode and follow a ''treasure map' created by his boyhood idol, former Nasa astronaut Gordon 'Gordo' Cooper.

programme.title: Dead of Winter
programme.desc: A case in which a teenage couple disappeared from a Colorado neighbourhood in the middle of winter. Their car turned up abandoned and burnt in a field. The spring thaw revealed a hideous truth that shocked the community.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: How scientific and forensic techniques can help solve puzzling crimes.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: How scientific and forensic techniques can help solve puzzling crimes.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: The murders of Tom and Jill Estes. When their bodies were found behind a dumpster in Missouri, police were baffled - until a receipt leads to CCTV of a blood-stained suspect.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: A case from 2008, when the discovery of the bullet-riddled bodies of 11-year-old Skyla Whitaker and 13-year-old Taylor Placker sent the Oklahoma community of Weleetka into a state of panic.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: The case of five-year-old Melissa Brannen, who was abducted from an early Christmas party in 1989 and never found despite extensive searches throughout her native Virginia.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Chief investigator Max Mixson rescues a seriously injured dog and surgeons battle to save its life.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown pays a visit to Kyabram Vet Clinic in the state of Victoria to lend a hand to an old friend.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Margarita already has two gowns but is determined to buy a third, while wedding-obsessed Amanda begins searching for her dream dress.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Randy assists brides and auditions models for his runway show. Bride Emanuela wants a sexy ballgown and is prepared to blow her father's budget to get it.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris takes us into the world of one of Sydney's busiest vets. A labrador is brought in with bulging eyeballs, and 60-year-old tortoise Hugo needs a mate.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Vet Lisa treats a cat badly injured in a hit-and-run, Chris devises a radical treatment for a bird and Pearl the blind seal undergoes a risky operation to restore her sight.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Part one of two. At nearly 900lbs Robert is bed-ridden and living in a nursing home, with lymphedema masses on each hip. He needs to summon up the resolve to make the radical life changes needed to save himself.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Part two of two. Following the efforts of bed-ridden Robert to make the radical life changes needed to save his life.

programme.title: My 600lb Life: Where Are They Now?
programme.desc: Lee's anger issues jeopardise his relationship with Rena and threaten to derail their weight-loss journeys. Plus, a major life event sends Sarah into depression.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The disappearance of Amy St Laurent after a night out with friends in October 2001. Investigators suspected Jeffery Gorman, who Amy had met at a club, of either kidnapping or killing her, but had insufficient evidence to press charges. However, Gorman later made a full murder confession in a telephone call to his mother.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: A different trio takes charge of the sales floor, but not everyone agrees that change is a good thing.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: The crew meets a celebrity designer and a bride-to-be who wants a wedding dress painted on her.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: How some brides struggle to find the perfect dress, and their idea of a perfect wedding can be put in doubt.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: A bride-to-be brings scorecards to rate her gowns, while another has her first fitting. Plus, the annual Blowout Sale begins.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: A woman's sorority sisters surprise her with a weekend trip, but there is something fishy about their appointment. Bride-to-be Lauren tries to please her aunt.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Camille brings along her mother-in-law, in the hope of improving their relationship. Plus, consultant Keasha helps her friend to find the perfect dress.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: New consultant Carmel receives a tall order from her first customer of the day, while another woman wants to spend $2,000 on an elaborate red dress.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: A woman refuses to stay within her budget while shopping for a dress, while Dorianne's father becomes emotional during her fitting.

programme.title: Long Island Medium
programme.desc: Theresa hits the road on a cross-country tour, delivering healing messages in numerous cities. However, as the end of the tour nears, going home weighs heavy on.

programme.title: Hoarding: Buried Alive
programme.desc: Mike is about to have surgery that could save his life, but he must declutter his home as the biohazards inside it will put his recovery at risk.

programme.title: Dead of Winter
programme.desc: The disappearance of 21-year-old Noel Alkaramla, who vanished just before Thanksgiving 2015. In November 2017, her stepfather Johnny Oquendo was put on trial for her murder.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Following the lives of people, each weighing over 600lbs. Through their year-long journeys, they attempt to lose thousands of pounds collectively, to survive.
